experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Built and maintained Sofomo's corporate website in Next.js with a focus on SEO, performance, and reusable UI components.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Contributed to the development and ongoing maintenance of Sofomo's public-facing website using Next.js and React. Delivered responsive, accessible UI components aligned with brand guidelines, and supported SEO and performance improvements (routing, code-splitting, image optimization). Worked in a production environment with strong attention to maintainability and clean component architecture.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Marketing sites must be fast, accessible, and easy to maintain while supporting frequent content updates and consistent branding.
experienceTimeline.solution: Implemented reusable React components with TypeScript, maintained CSS Modules styling conventions, and supported SEO/performance improvements (routing, image optimization, code-splitting).
experienceTimeline.impact: Delivered a stable, scalable website foundation that supports ongoing marketing needs and provides a strong public presence for the brand.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Implemented Selenium-based QA automation with Jenkins CI and built a Next.js dashboard for non-technical test execution and reporting.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Worked on QA automation for an internal Salesforce-based application. Created and maintained Selenium test suites, integrated automated runs with Jenkins, and supported a stable CI workflow. Built a lightweight Next.js interface that allowed non-technical users to trigger test runs and review Jenkins results, improving visibility and reducing manual QA coordination.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Non-technical stakeholders needed visibility and control over automated runs, and QA pipelines had to be stable and reproducible in CI.
experienceTimeline.solution: Implemented automated UI tests (Selenium/Java), configured Jenkins pipelines, and created a Next.js interface connected to Jenkins to run tests and surface outcomes in a simple, user-friendly way.
experienceTimeline.impact: Reduced manual QA coordination and improved transparency of automated test results for a broader group of stakeholders.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Developed Vue.js modules deployed inside NetSuite to support employee time tracking and internal CRM workflows for a US healthcare staffing company.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Built and extended front-end modules for FlexCare (US healthcare staffing), delivering a time-tracking and internal workflow UI deployed within the NetSuite environment. Focused on reliable day-to-day usability for operational teams, integrating with CRM processes and NetSuite data while working within platform constraints.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Operational users needed a simple, dependable interface, while NetSuite deployment and integration constraints limited the available tooling and patterns.
experienceTimeline.solution: Implemented Vue-based modules in JavaScript, integrated with CRM-related processes, and optimized UI flows to reduce manual effort for users. Kept the UI lightweight and aligned with business workflows.
experienceTimeline.impact: Improved efficiency of time entry and internal processes by providing a clearer, purpose-built UI inside NetSuite.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Built React and Vue front-end extensions for NetSuite ERP, delivering deployable UI modules that enhance native workflows.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Developing standalone front-end modules in React and Vue that extend native NetSuite ERP functionality for US-based operations. Work includes building reusable UI components, managing complex state (Redux where needed), aligning with SuiteScript-backed flows, and ensuring smooth deployment and compatibility within NetSuite.
experienceTimeline.challenge: NetSuite imposes constraints on deployment, runtime, and integration patterns, requiring careful engineering to deliver modern UX without breaking compatibility.
experienceTimeline.solution: Developed reusable UI components, managed complex state (Redux where appropriate), integrated with NetSuite/SuiteScript flows, and ensured modules remained stable across deployments. Used Tailwind to keep UI consistent and fast to iterate.
experienceTimeline.impact: Delivered maintainable UI extensions that improved internal workflows and reduced friction for day-to-day NetSuite users.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Built a headless Shopify storefront using React, Remix, and Hydrogen, integrating Shopify APIs and translating Liquid concepts into reusable components.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Worked on a commercial headless commerce build in close cooperation with Shopify. Implemented a React-based storefront using Remix and Shopify Hydrogen, consuming Shopify APIs and translating Liquid-driven behaviors into reusable React components. Focused on performance, SEO-friendly routing, and maintainable patterns in a fast-moving e-commerce codebase. Added unit and component tests to improve stability during iterative development.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Traditional Liquid themes limited flexibility and performance tuning, while a headless approach required careful API modeling, SEO-friendly routing, and stable UI patterns under rapid iteration.
experienceTimeline.solution: Implemented Hydrogen/Remix routes and reusable React components, optimized data fetching, and introduced unit/component tests to reduce regressions. Styled consistently with Tailwind and maintained a developer-friendly setup via Vite.
experienceTimeline.impact: Improved maintainability and iteration speed for a production e-commerce storefront while keeping strong performance and SEO foundations.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Lead Front-end Developer for a UX/UI learning platform, owning front-end architecture and delivering a scalable Next.js + React UI.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: Octopus is a Poland-based learning platform for UX/UI professionals. As Lead Front-end Developer, I owned front-end architecture and implementation standards, partnering with design and product to ship a consistent, accessible UI. Built scalable components and pages in Next.js/React, improved performance for content-heavy views, and supported team delivery through code reviews and technical guidance.
experienceTimeline.challenge: The product required a consistent, accessible UI and strong performance on content-heavy pages, while supporting rapid iteration and multiple contributors.
experienceTimeline.solution: Designed a scalable component architecture, implemented key views in Next.js/React, and introduced conventions for code structure and review. Focused on performance, accessibility, and a consistent Tailwind-based UI system.
experienceTimeline.impact: Enabled faster feature delivery with a maintainable UI foundation, improved consistency across the product, and supported team productivity through clear front-end standards.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Commercial website for a beauty salon, built as an early React project with a focus on UI styling and client needs.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: BeautyLash was one of my first commercial front-end projects, created before starting my professional career. It was a website for an eyelash beautician salon, designed to present services, pricing, and contact information in a clean and visually appealing way. The project was built using React and styled-components, with a strong focus on layout, styling, and responsiveness. Although the original site is no longer live, a deployed version is available for preview purposes.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Designing and implementing a complete commercial website independently while learning React and modern styling approaches.
experienceTimeline.solution: Built a React-based application using styled-components and SCSS, focusing on reusable components, consistent styling, and a responsive layout tailored to the client’s business needs.
experienceTimeline.impact: Delivered a fully functional commercial website for a real client, gaining hands-on experience with client communication, project ownership, and modern front-end development fundamentals.

experienceTimeline.shortDescription: Modern business website built with Next.js for a gas heating systems installer.
experienceTimeline.longDescription: AS Serwis is a modern business website created for a gas heating devices installer. The project focused on clarity, performance, and trust-building for a service-oriented business. Built with Next.js and TypeScript, the site emphasizes fast load times, SEO-friendly structure, and maintainable styling using CSS Modules. The application was deployed on Vercel and designed to be easily extendable as the business grows.
experienceTimeline.challenge: Creating a professional, trustworthy online presence for a technical service business while maintaining high performance and clean architecture.
experienceTimeline.solution: Implemented a Next.js application with TypeScript and CSS Modules, focusing on semantic structure, responsive design, and SEO best practices. Deployed using Vercel for reliability and fast delivery.
experienceTimeline.impact: Delivered a production-ready website that supports business visibility, improves client trust, and demonstrates modern front-end development practices.

about.intro: Front-end Developer with 4+ years of commercial experience building React and TypeScript applications—from headless Shopify e-commerce (Remix/Hydrogen) to enterprise NetSuite (React/Vue) extensions. Strong focus on performance, scalable UI architecture, maintainable code, and automated testing in international, cross-functional teams.
